title: Fish Amok
description: A traditional Cambodian dish of fish cooked in a coconut curry and wrapped in banana leaves.

title: Beef Lok Lak
description: Stir-fried beef served with lettuce, tomato, cucumber, and a tangy lime-pepper sauce.

title: Kuy Teav
description: A flavorful noodle soup with pork or beef, fresh herbs, and a savory broth.

title: Nom Banh Chok
description: Rice noodles topped with a light fish curry sauce and fresh vegetables.

title: Prahok Ktiss
description: A savory dip made from fermented fish paste, minced pork, and coconut milk, served with fresh vegetables.

title: Samlor Korko
description: A thick, hearty soup made with mixed vegetables, fish, and Cambodian kroeung spices.

title: Samlor Machu Kroeung
description: A sour and spicy soup with beef, water spinach, and Cambodian herbs.

title: Bai Sach Chrouk
description: Grilled pork marinated in coconut milk, served over rice with pickled vegetables.

title: Cha Kdav
description: A spicy stir-fry with frog legs, lemongrass, chili, and Cambodian spices.

title: Num Ansom Chek
description: A sticky rice cake filled with banana and wrapped in banana leaves.

title: Nom Krok
description: Mini coconut rice cakes with a crispy outer layer and soft, sweet inside.

title: Nom Ka Chai
description: Savory fried chive cakes served with a sweet-spicy sauce.

title: Bobor Dessert
description: A sweet rice porridge dessert made with coconut milk and mung beans.

title: Nom Pang
description: A Cambodian-style baguette sandwich filled with grilled meat, pickled vegetables, and fresh herbs.

title: Twa Ko
description: Cambodian-style grilled sausage made from pork and spices.

title: Teuk Ampil
description: A refreshing sour tamarind juice with a hint of sugar and salt.

title: Teuk Tnaot
description: Fresh palm juice straight from Cambodiaâ€™s sugar palm trees.

title: Teuk Mpov
description: Sweet sugarcane juice served cold with ice.

title: Cambodian Iced Coffee
description: Strong coffee brewed with condensed milk and served over ice.
